patternOptionsDescription.message: Here you can specify file name extensions for various page addresses using regular expressions

beeCtlAppVersionRequirement.description: Minimum BeeCtl app version requirement text

patternListLabel.message: File name extensions based on URL patterns

shellCommandInputDescription.message: Specify the shell command to launch your preferred text editor. A path to a temporary file will be appended dynamically. You can use the placeholders ${line} and ${column} to set the 1-based cursor position, for example: /usr/local/bin/gvim --nofork +'call cursor(${line}, ${column})'. Both single and double quotes will be expanded automatically.

shellCommandInputPathNote.message: Although the host application resolves the executable from the PATH environment variable, absolute paths are strongly encouraged.

shellCommandInputPathLabel.description: Shell command input field label text
